Canelo Álvarez da el peso sin problema, Kovalev hace varios intentos
Saúl “Canelo” Álvarez dio el peso sin problema de 174.5 libras, mientras que Sergey Kovalev tuvo que hacer por lo menos cuatro intentos y despojarse de su ropa para dar las 175 libras
01 Nov 2019, 18:00 by Cornelio Figueroa
El boxeador mexicano Saúl “Canelo” Álvarez ganó la primera parte de su combate ante el ruso Sergey Kovalev, este viernes durante la ceremonia de pesaje. El mexicano no tuvo problema alguno para dar el peso pactado para su encuentro ante el ruso, registrando 174.5 libras, mientras que su rival el campeón Semicompleto de la OMB no dio el peso en su primer intento.
El ruso Sergey Kovalev, en su primer intento, detuvo la báscula en 176 libras; en su segundo intento, donde se quitó el collar, dio 175.5; mientras que en el tercer intento tuvo que desnudarse y dio 175.25 libras, un cuarto de libra pasado del límite.



Tras ausentarse cinco minutos y hacer una serie de movimientos, el ruso regresó a la báscula para ahora sí dar el peso. En los vestidores tuvo que escupir en el baño para después volver y subir de nuevo sin ropa y así dar las 175 libras pactadas.






Mientras tanto, el “Canelo” no tuvo problema en dar el peso. Tras este incidente que le puso emoción a la ceremonia del pesaje, la pelea sigue programada para este sábado en Las Vegas.


Canelo Álvarez y Sergey Kovalev tras la ceremonia de pesaje/AFP

El mexicano llega a la cita con un registro de 52-1-2, 35 de sus triunfos han sido por la vía rápida.
Por su parte Kovalev, de 36 años, llega con un registro de 34-3-1, de estos 29 nocáuts, ha boxeado durante toda su carrera, que comenzó en 2009.

Canelo Álvarez gives the weight without problem, Kovalev makes several attempts
Saúl “Canelo” Álvarez gave the weight without problem of 174.5 pounds, while Sergey Kovalev had to make at least four attempts and shed his clothes to give 175 pounds
01 Nov 2019, 18:00 by Cornelio Figueroa
Mexican boxer Saul “Canelo” Álvarez won the first part of his fight against Russian Sergey Kovalev, this Friday during the weighing ceremony. The Mexican had no problem to give the agreed weight for his match against the Russian, registering 174.5 pounds, while his rival the WBO Semicomplete champion did not give the weight in his first attempt.
Russian Sergey Kovalev, on his first attempt, stopped the scale at 176 pounds; on his second attempt, where he took off his necklace, he gave 175.5; while on the third attempt he had to undress and gave 175.25 pounds, a quarter pound past the limit.



After missing five minutes and making a series of movements, the Russian returned to the scale to now give weight. In the dressing rooms he had to spit in the bathroom and then return and climb again without clothes and thus give the 175 pounds agreed.






Meanwhile, the "Canelo" had no problem in giving weight. After this incident that brought emotion to the weighing ceremony, the fight is still scheduled for this Saturday in Las Vegas.


Canelo Álvarez and Sergey Kovalev after the weighing ceremony / AFP

The Mexican arrives at the appointment with a record of 52-1-2, 35 of his wins have been on the fast track.
For his part, Kovalev, 36, arrives with a 34-3-1 record, of these 29 knockouts, he has boxed throughout his career, which began in 2009.
